trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Recommendations: JavaScript Integration | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Recommendations: JavaScript Integration | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations - JavaScript Integration – documentation
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations - JavaScript Integration – documentation

trans-unit.source: This document depict how to integrate your site using JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: This document depict how to integrate your site using JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: The JavaScript enables you to send Data Acquisition events and to consume recommendations once you build a recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: The JavaScript enables you to send Data Acquisition events and to consume recommendations once you build a recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: All operations done via JS can be also done from server side.
trans-unit.target: All operations done via JS can be also done from server side.

trans-unit.source: Integrating your site with Azure ML Recommendations consist on 2 Phases:
trans-unit.target: Integrating your site with Azure ML Recommendations consist on 2 Phases:

trans-unit.source: Send Events into Azure ML Recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Send Events into Azure ML Recommendations.

trans-unit.source: This will enable to build a recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: This will enable to build a recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: Consume the recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Consume the recommendations.

trans-unit.source: After the model is built you can consume the recommendations.
trans-unit.target: After the model is built you can consume the recommendations.

trans-unit.source: (This document does not explain how to build a model, read the quick start guide to get more information on how).
trans-unit.target: (This document does not explain how to build a model, read the quick start guide to get more information on how).

trans-unit.source: <ins>Phase I</ins>
trans-unit.target: <ins>Phase I</ins>

trans-unit.source: In the first phase you insert into your html pages a small JavaScript library that enables the page to send events as they occur on the html page into Azure ML Recommendations servers (via Data Market):
trans-unit.target: In the first phase you insert into your html pages a small JavaScript library that enables the page to send events as they occur on the html page into Azure ML Recommendations servers (via Data Market):

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Drawing1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Drawing1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <ins>Phase II</ins>
trans-unit.target: <ins>Phase II</ins>

trans-unit.source: In the second phase when you want to show the recommendations on the page you select one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: In the second phase when you want to show the recommendations on the page you select one of the following options:

trans-unit.source: 1.Your server (on the phase of page rendering) calls Azure ML Recommendations Server (via Data Market) to get recommendations.
trans-unit.target: 1.Your server (on the phase of page rendering) calls Azure ML Recommendations Server (via Data Market) to get recommendations.

trans-unit.source: The results include a list of items id.
trans-unit.target: The results include a list of items id.

trans-unit.source: Your server needs to enrich the results with the items Meta data (e.g. images, description) and send the created page to the browser.
trans-unit.target: Your server needs to enrich the results with the items Meta data (e.g. images, description) and send the created page to the browser.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Drawing2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Drawing2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: 2.The other option is to use the small JavaScript file from phase one to get a simple list of recommended items.
trans-unit.target: 2.The other option is to use the small JavaScript file from phase one to get a simple list of recommended items.

trans-unit.source: The data received here is leaner than the one in the first option.
trans-unit.target: The data received here is leaner than the one in the first option.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Drawing3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Drawing3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create a new model using the APIs.
trans-unit.target: Create a new model using the APIs.

trans-unit.source: See the Quick start guide on how to do it.
trans-unit.target: See the Quick start guide on how to do it.

trans-unit.source: Encode your <dataMarketUser>:<dataMarketKey> with base64.
trans-unit.target: Encode your <dataMarketUser>:<dataMarketKey> with base64.

trans-unit.source: (This will be used for the basic authentication to enable the JS code to call the APIs).
trans-unit.target: (This will be used for the basic authentication to enable the JS code to call the APIs).

trans-unit.source: The following steps facilitate sending events:
trans-unit.target: The following steps facilitate sending events:

trans-unit.source: Include JQuery library in your code.
trans-unit.target: Include JQuery library in your code.

trans-unit.source: You can download it from nuget in the following URL.
trans-unit.target: You can download it from nuget in the following URL.

trans-unit.source: Include the Recommendations Java Script library from the following URL: http://1drv.ms/1Aoa1Zp
trans-unit.target: Include the Recommendations Java Script library from the following URL: http://1drv.ms/1Aoa1Zp

trans-unit.source: Initialize Azure ML Recommendations library with the appropriate parameters.
trans-unit.target: Initialize Azure ML Recommendations library with the appropriate parameters.

trans-unit.source: Send the appropriate event.
trans-unit.target: Send the appropriate event.

trans-unit.source: See detailed section below on all type of events (example of click event)
trans-unit.target: See detailed section below on all type of events (example of click event)

trans-unit.source: This is a reference implementation and it is given as is.
trans-unit.target: This is a reference implementation and it is given as is.

trans-unit.source: It should support all major browsers.
trans-unit.target: It should support all major browsers.

trans-unit.source: There are 5 types of event that the library supports: Click, Recommendation Click, Add to Shop Cart, Remove from Shop Cart and Purchase.
trans-unit.target: There are 5 types of event that the library supports: Click, Recommendation Click, Add to Shop Cart, Remove from Shop Cart and Purchase.

trans-unit.source: There is an additional event that is used to set the user context called Login.
trans-unit.target: There is an additional event that is used to set the user context called Login.

trans-unit.source: This event should be used any time a user clicked on an item.
trans-unit.target: This event should be used any time a user clicked on an item.

trans-unit.source: Usually when user clicks on an item a new page is opened with the item details; in this page this event should be triggered.
trans-unit.target: Usually when user clicks on an item a new page is opened with the item details; in this page this event should be triggered.

trans-unit.source: Parameters:
trans-unit.target: Parameters:

trans-unit.source: event (string, mandatory) – “click”
trans-unit.target: event (string, mandatory) – “click”

trans-unit.source: item (string, mandatory) – Unique identifier of the item
trans-unit.target: item (string, mandatory) – Unique identifier of the item

trans-unit.source: itemName (string, optional) – the name of the item
trans-unit.target: itemName (string, optional) – the name of the item

trans-unit.source: itemDescription (string, optional) – the description of the item
trans-unit.target: itemDescription (string, optional) – the description of the item

trans-unit.source: itemCategory (string, optional) – the category of the item
trans-unit.target: itemCategory (string, optional) – the category of the item

trans-unit.source: Or with optional data:
trans-unit.target: Or with optional data:

trans-unit.source: This event should be used any time a user clicked on an item that was received from Azure ML Recommendations as a recommended item.
trans-unit.target: This event should be used any time a user clicked on an item that was received from Azure ML Recommendations as a recommended item.

trans-unit.source: Usually when user clicks on an item a new page is opened with the item details; in this page this event should be triggered.
trans-unit.target: Usually when user clicks on an item a new page is opened with the item details; in this page this event should be triggered.

trans-unit.source: Parameters:
trans-unit.target: Parameters:

trans-unit.source: event (string, mandatory) – “recommendationclick”
trans-unit.target: event (string, mandatory) – “recommendationclick”

trans-unit.source: item (string, mandatory) – Unique identifier of the item
trans-unit.target: item (string, mandatory) – Unique identifier of the item

trans-unit.source: itemName (string, optional) – the name of the item
trans-unit.target: itemName (string, optional) – the name of the item

trans-unit.source: itemDescription (string, optional) – the description of the item
trans-unit.target: itemDescription (string, optional) – the description of the item

trans-unit.source: itemCategory (string, optional) – the category of the item
trans-unit.target: itemCategory (string, optional) – the category of the item

trans-unit.source: seeds (string array, optional) – the seeds that generated the recommendation query.
trans-unit.target: seeds (string array, optional) – the seeds that generated the recommendation query.

trans-unit.source: recoList (string array, optional) – the result of the recommendation request that generated the item that was clicked.
trans-unit.target: recoList (string array, optional) – the result of the recommendation request that generated the item that was clicked.

trans-unit.source: Or with optional data:
trans-unit.target: Or with optional data:

trans-unit.source: This event should be used when the user add an item to the shopping cart.
trans-unit.target: This event should be used when the user add an item to the shopping cart.

trans-unit.source: Parameters:
trans-unit.target: Parameters:

trans-unit.source: event (string, mandatory) – “addshopcart”
trans-unit.target: event (string, mandatory) – “addshopcart”

trans-unit.source: item (string, mandatory) – Unique identifier of the item
trans-unit.target: item (string, mandatory) – Unique identifier of the item

trans-unit.source: itemName (string, optional) – the name of the item
trans-unit.target: itemName (string, optional) – the name of the item

trans-unit.source: itemDescription (string, optional) – the description of the item
trans-unit.target: itemDescription (string, optional) – the description of the item

trans-unit.source: itemCategory (string, optional) – the category of the item
trans-unit.target: itemCategory (string, optional) – the category of the item

trans-unit.source: This event should be used when the user removes an item to the shopping cart.
trans-unit.target: This event should be used when the user removes an item to the shopping cart.

trans-unit.source: Parameters:
trans-unit.target: Parameters:

trans-unit.source: event (string, mandatory) – “removeshopcart”
trans-unit.target: event (string, mandatory) – “removeshopcart”

trans-unit.source: item (string, mandatory) – Unique identifier of the item
trans-unit.target: item (string, mandatory) – Unique identifier of the item

trans-unit.source: itemName (string, optional) – the name of the item
trans-unit.target: itemName (string, optional) – the name of the item

trans-unit.source: itemDescription (string, optional) – the description of the item
trans-unit.target: itemDescription (string, optional) – the description of the item

trans-unit.source: itemCategory (string, optional) – the category of the item
trans-unit.target: itemCategory (string, optional) – the category of the item

trans-unit.source: This event should be used when the user purchased his shopping cart.
trans-unit.target: This event should be used when the user purchased his shopping cart.

trans-unit.source: Parameters:
trans-unit.target: Parameters:

trans-unit.source: event (string) – “purchase”
trans-unit.target: event (string) – “purchase”

trans-unit.source:
items ( Purchased[] ) – Array holding an entry for each item purchased.

Purchased format:
trans-unit.target:
items ( Purchased[] ) – Array holding an entry for each item purchased.

Purchased format:

trans-unit.source: item (string) - Unique identifier of the item.
trans-unit.target: item (string) - Unique identifier of the item.

trans-unit.source: count (int or string) – number of items that were purchased.
trans-unit.target: count (int or string) – number of items that were purchased.

trans-unit.source: price (float or string) – optional field – the price of the item.
trans-unit.target: price (float or string) – optional field – the price of the item.

trans-unit.source: The example below shows purchase of 3 items (33, 34, 35), two with all fields populated (item, count, price) and one (item 34) without a price.
trans-unit.target: The example below shows purchase of 3 items (33, 34, 35), two with all fields populated (item, count, price) and one (item 34) without a price.

trans-unit.source: Azure ML Recommendations Event library creates and use a cookie in order to identify events that came from the same browser.
trans-unit.target: Azure ML Recommendations Event library creates and use a cookie in order to identify events that came from the same browser.

trans-unit.source: In order to improve the model results Azure ML Recommendations enables to set a user unique identification that will override the cookie usage.
trans-unit.target: In order to improve the model results Azure ML Recommendations enables to set a user unique identification that will override the cookie usage.

trans-unit.source: This event should be used after the user login to your site.
trans-unit.target: This event should be used after the user login to your site.

trans-unit.source: Parameters:
trans-unit.target: Parameters:

trans-unit.source: event (string) – “userlogin”
trans-unit.target: event (string) – “userlogin”

trans-unit.source: user (string) – unique identification of the user.
trans-unit.target: user (string) – unique identification of the user.

trans-unit.source:
<script>
        if (typeof AzureMLRecommendationsEvent=="undefined") { AzureMLRecommendationsEvent = []; }
        AzureMLRecommendationsEvent.push({event: "userlogin", user: “ABCD10AA” });
    </script>
trans-unit.target:
<script>
        if (typeof AzureMLRecommendationsEvent=="undefined") { AzureMLRecommendationsEvent = []; }
        AzureMLRecommendationsEvent.push({event: "userlogin", user: “ABCD10AA” });
    </script>

trans-unit.source: The code that consumes the recommendation is triggered by some JavaScript event by the client’s webpage.
trans-unit.target: The code that consumes the recommendation is triggered by some JavaScript event by the client’s webpage.

trans-unit.source: The recommendation response includes the recommended items Ids, their names and their ratings.
trans-unit.target: The recommendation response includes the recommended items Ids, their names and their ratings.

trans-unit.source: It’s best to use this option only for a list display of the recommended items – more complex handling (such as adding the item’s metadata) should be done on the server side integration.
trans-unit.target: It’s best to use this option only for a list display of the recommended items – more complex handling (such as adding the item’s metadata) should be done on the server side integration.

trans-unit.source: To consume recommendations you need to include the required JavaScript libraries in your page and to call AzureMLRecommendationsStart.
trans-unit.target: To consume recommendations you need to include the required JavaScript libraries in your page and to call AzureMLRecommendationsStart.

trans-unit.source: See section 2.
trans-unit.target: See section 2.

trans-unit.source: To consume recommendations for one or more items you need to call a method called: AzureMLRecommendationsGetI2IRecommendation.
trans-unit.target: To consume recommendations for one or more items you need to call a method called: AzureMLRecommendationsGetI2IRecommendation.

trans-unit.source: Parameters:
trans-unit.target: Parameters:

trans-unit.source: items (array of strings) – One or more items to get recommendations for.
trans-unit.target: items (array of strings) – One or more items to get recommendations for.

trans-unit.source: If you consume an Fbt build then you can set here only one item.
trans-unit.target: If you consume an Fbt build then you can set here only one item.

trans-unit.source: numberOfResults (int) – number of required results.
trans-unit.target: numberOfResults (int) – number of required results.

trans-unit.source: includeMetadata (boolean, optional) – if set to ‘true’ indicates that the metadata field must be populated in the result.
trans-unit.target: includeMetadata (boolean, optional) – if set to ‘true’ indicates that the metadata field must be populated in the result.

trans-unit.source: Processing function – a function that will handle the recommendations returned.
trans-unit.target: Processing function – a function that will handle the recommendations returned.

trans-unit.source: The data is returned as an array of:
trans-unit.target: The data is returned as an array of:

trans-unit.source: Item – item unique id
trans-unit.target: Item – item unique id

trans-unit.source: name – item name (if exist in catalog)
trans-unit.target: name – item name (if exist in catalog)

trans-unit.source: rating – recommendation rating
trans-unit.target: rating – recommendation rating

trans-unit.source: metadata – a string that represents the metadata of the item
trans-unit.target: metadata – a string that represents the metadata of the item

trans-unit.source: Example: The following code requests 8 recommendations for item "64f6eb0d-947a-4c18-a16c-888da9e228ba" (and by not specifying includeMetadata – it implicitly says that no metadata is required), it then concatenate the results into a buffer.
trans-unit.target: Example: The following code requests 8 recommendations for item "64f6eb0d-947a-4c18-a16c-888da9e228ba" (and by not specifying includeMetadata – it implicitly says that no metadata is required), it then concatenate the results into a buffer.
